definitions.definition: To leave or withdraw from; to quit ; to retire from.
examples: The firefighters told us to evacuate the area as the flames approached.

definitions.definition: To cause (or help) to leave or withdraw from.
examples: The firefighters decided to evacuate all the inhabitants from the street.

definitions.definition: To make empty ; to empty out ; to remove the contents of, including to create a vacuum .
examples: The scientist evacuated the chamber before filling it with nitrogen.

definitions.definition: To remove ; to eject ; to void ; to discharge , as the contents of a vessel , or of the bowels .
To make void; to nullify ; to vacate .
examples: to evacuate a contract or marriage

main_definition: ( transitive ) To leave or withdraw from; to quit ; to retire from.
secondary_definitions: To cause (or help) to leave or withdraw from.
To make empty ; to empty out ; to remove the contents of, including to create a vacuum .
( figurative ) To make empty; to deprive .
To remove ; to eject ; to void ; to discharge , as the contents of a vessel , or of the bowels .
To make void; to nullify ; to vacate .
